item.title:

item.title: R to @fede_intern: thanks @diego_aligned @MauroAligned @mpaulucci_ @lean_knack @pablodeymo @JuanBono @Pat_Ventuzelo and many others from Lambda and Fuzzing Labs for chosing to work with me and tolerate my craziness.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description: thanks @diego_aligned @MauroAligned @mpaulucci_ @lean_knack @pablodeymo @JuanBono @Pat_Ventuzelo and many others from Lambda and Fuzzing Labs for chosing to work with me and tolerate my craziness.

item.title:
Since I‚Äôm a kid I always wanted to help by finding security vulnerabilities in public goods. A little bit more than a decade ago when I started Lambda, this would have been impossible for us, we were making 3 dollars per hour. Now we can invest in research and we can give back to society by finding bugs.
I really love to feel I‚Äôm the stupidest person in the team and that I can learn something new every day. I‚Äôm super proud and happy to be able to work with such a talented team of people in @class_lambda and @FuzzingLabs. Thanks life for giving me such a joy. Few things give me more energy than to go to the office.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:

item.title: R to @fede_intern: blogpost: https://fuzzinglabs.com/raydium-dos-initialization/
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description: blogpost: fuzzinglabs.com/raydium-dos-‚Ä¶

item.title:
Our boss @Pat_Ventuzelo and our team at @FuzzingLabs has found a new security vulnerability in @solana @RaydiumProtocol: DOS Vulnerability in Raydium CLMM Pool Initialization.
The vulnerability resided in the pool initialization code of the Raydium CLMM program.
The key vulnerability lay in the uniqueness of the pool_state for each token pair combination and the open_time parameter, which determined when the pool would become active for trading. This parameter was accepted without any bounds checking.
As always I‚Äôm super proud to work with Patrick and FuzzingLabs that are doing amazing work in Ethereum, ZK, Solana and in AI. If you need to work with a top notch team of hackers I highly recommend to connect directly with him or write me via DM.
item.dc:creator: @fede_intern
item.description:
Our boss @Pat_Ventuzelo and our team at @FuzzingLabs has found a new security vulnerability in @solana @RaydiumProtocol: DOS Vulnerability in Raydium CLMM Pool Initialization.

The vulnerability resided in the pool initialization code of the Raydium CLMM program.

The key vulnerability lay in the uniqueness of the pool_state for each token pair combination and the open_time parameter, which determined when the pool would become active for trading. This parameter was accepted without any bounds checking.

As always I‚Äôm super proud to work with Patrick and FuzzingLabs that are doing amazing work in Ethereum, ZK, Solana and in AI. If you need to work with a top notch team of hackers I highly recommend to connect directly with him or write me via DM.

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: For all you haters of DeepSeek who think it's just a piece of CCP propaganda riddle me this:
Y didn't a large Chinese corporate, university, or local govt funded startup that has received hundreds of billions of yuan in govt funding to circumvent US high end chip controls and obtain supremacy in AI create DeepSeek?
Y was it some random Hangzhou hedge fund? The CCP has no love for hedge funds, if you have ever traded China u would know how frustrating it is sometimes to trade vs. equity and bond markets in the west.
I don't know shit about AI, but this doesn't sound like the way China likes to "innovate" and the wrong type of people are doing the innovating. These aren't my original thots, thanks @Gavekal.
But the more you question, the less you want to buy US markets trading at an all time high of 230% of GDP, that's higher than the 2000 tech bubble at 175% or 1929 at 130%. And if people rotate out of US stocks where are the cap gains taxes going to come from? Instead of a 3% deficit in 2028 (one of Bessent's 3 arrows), maybe it will be 7% 8% 9% or 10%?
Once you start to question, your mind goes to dangerous places.
item.dc:creator: @CryptoHayes
item.description:
For all you haters of DeepSeek who think it's just a piece of CCP propaganda riddle me this:

Y didn't a large Chinese corporate, university, or local govt funded startup that has received hundreds of billions of yuan in govt funding to circumvent US high end chip controls and obtain supremacy in AI create DeepSeek?

Y was it some random Hangzhou hedge fund? The CCP has no love for hedge funds, if you have ever traded China u would know how frustrating it is sometimes to trade vs. equity and bond markets in the west.

I don't know shit about AI, but this doesn't sound like the way China likes to "innovate" and the wrong type of people are doing the innovating. These aren't my original thots, thanks @Gavekal.

But the more you question, the less you want to buy US markets trading at an all time high of 230% of GDP, that's higher than the 2000 tech bubble at 175% or 1929 at 130%. And if people rotate out of US stocks where are the cap gains taxes going to come from? Instead of a 3% deficit in 2028 (one of Bessent's 3 arrows), maybe it will be 7% 8% 9% or 10%?

Once you start to question, your mind goes to dangerous places.

item.title: RT by @fede_intern: Critics say Vitalik Buterin isn‚Äôt doing enough to promote Ethereum ü§î But @cdixon argues it‚Äôs an unfair expectation üôÖ ‚ÄúEthereum is so decentralized now, with hundreds of projects and a vibrant L2 ecosystem. item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: EigenLayer AI Update --------------------------- To have an agent be verifiable, the agent needs to publish the data in a publicly readable DA. This is why @eigen_da is designed to be hyperscale.
Excited to see this upgrade on the path to fully autonomous, fully verifiable agents!
item.dc:creator: @sreeramkannan
item.description:
EigenLayer AI Update
---------------------------
To have an agent be verifiable, the agent needs to publish the data in a publicly readable DA. This is why @eigen_da is designed to be hyperscale.

Excited to see this upgrade on the path to fully autonomous, fully verifiable agents!

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: Hard agree with @fede_intern here.
But why do any of these differentiators matter for Ethereum.
Because Ethereum is the only chain building fully free, open, unstoppable financial APIs.

item.title:
RT by @fede_intern: Elixir Ethereum Consensus Client Updates ‚ö°Ô∏è
# Server - Long Running Sessions (Sepolia)
The node was running for the last 10 days with 2 interruptions: - Non critical issues: #1326 - Issues that caused interruption: #1321 (both interruptions were caused by the same issue)
# Open PRs
After some fixes we were able to merge all outstanding PRs except for: - #1365 (Open for review): SSE implementation of the Events endpoint, with support for block and finalized_checkpoints events. - #1324 (Draft): Fixes and additions of new endpoints as prereqs for assertoor, this depends on #1365 .
# Assertoor Implementation
- Once #1365 & #1324 are merged we could integrate with assertoor and start adding our own initial checks as part of the CI.
item.dc:creator: @class_lambda
item.description:
Elixir Ethereum Consensus Client Updates ‚ö°Ô∏è

# Server - Long Running Sessions (Sepolia)

The node was running for the last 10 days with 2 interruptions:
- Non critical issues: #1326
- Issues that caused interruption: #1321 (both interruptions were caused by the same issue)

# Open PRs

After some fixes we were able to merge all outstanding PRs except for:
- #1365 (Open for review): SSE implementation of the Events endpoint, with support for block and finalized_checkpoints events.
- #1324 (Draft): Fixes and additions of new endpoints as prereqs for assertoor, this depends on #1365 .

# Assertoor Implementation

- Once #1365 & #1324 are merged we could integrate with assertoor and start adding our own initial checks as part of the CI.
